<div style="WIDTH: 100%" id="DSPFPageHeader"><a style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" 
href="#TableofContents">Table of Contents</a></div>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Capital Resources and Liquidity</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Operating Cash 
Flows</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Cash flows provided by operating activities during the six 
months ended June 30, 2016 were $0.1 million, related to revenue received of 
$2.3 million and dividend income received of $0.1 million, partially offset by 
operating expenses of $1.6 million, management fees of $0.7 million and general 
and administrative expenses of $0.1 million.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Cash flows provided by operating activities during the six 
months ended June 30, 2015 were $35 thousand, related to revenue received of 
$1.2 million, partially offset by management fees of $0.7 million and operating 
expenses of $0.4 million.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Investing Cash 
Flows</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Cash flows used in investing activities during the six months 
ended June 30, 2016 were $2.3 million, related to capital expenditures for oil 
and gas properties and investment in Delta House of $2.1 million and investments
in salvage fund of $0.2 million.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Cash flows used in investing activities during the six months 
ended June 30, 2015 were $5.8 million, primarily related to capital expenditures
for oil and gas properties and investment in Delta House, inclusive of 
advances.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Financing Cash 
Flows</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">There were no cash flows from financing activities during the 
six months ended June 30, 2016.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Cash flows provided by financing activities during the six 
months ended June 30, 2015 were $6.5 million, related to proceeds from long-term
borrowings of $6.7 million, partially offset by manager and shareholder 
distributions totaling $0.2 million.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Estimated Capital Expenditures</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Capital 
Commitments</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Fund has entered into multiple agreements for the 
acquisition, drilling and development of its oil and gas properties. The 
estimated capital expenditures associated with these agreements vary depending 
on the stage of development on a property-by-property basis.&#160; As of June 
30, 2016, the Fund had one property, the Beta Project, for which additional 
development costs must be incurred in order to commence production.&#160; The 
Fund currently expects to spend an additional $11.3 million (which includes 
asset retirement obligations) related to the development of the Beta Project, 
which the Fund anticipates will include the development of four wells with
related platform and pipeline infrastructure.&#160;During third quarter 2016, 
one well in the Beta Project commenced production. See &#8220;Business 
Update&#8221; under this Item 2. <font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#8220;Management&#8217;s 
Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&#8221; 
of this Quarterly Report for information regarding the Fund&#8217;s current 
projects. </font>See &#8220;Liquidity Needs&#8221; below for additional 
information.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Capital expenditures for oil and gas properties have been 
funded with the capital raised by the Fund in its private placement offering, 
and in certain circumstances, through debt financing.&#160; The number of 
projects in which the Fund could invest was limited, and each unsuccessful 
project the Fund experienced exhausted its capital and reduced its ability to 
generate revenue.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Liquidity Needs</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Fund&#8217;s primary short-term liquidity needs are to fund
its operations and capital expenditures for its oil and gas properties.&#160; 
Such needs are funded utilizing operating income, existing cash on-hand and 
borrowings.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As of June 30, 2016, the Fund&#8217;s estimated capital 
commitments related to its oil and gas properties were $18.5 million (which 
include asset retirement obligations for the Fund&#8217;s projects of $5.9 
million and projected interest costs of $0.2 million for the Beta Project), of 
which $7.2 million is expected to be spent during the next twelve months.&#160; 
These expected capital commitments exceed available working capital and salvage 
fund by $19.1 million as of June 30, 2016. The Fund has entered into a credit 
agreement to provide capital for the Beta Project.&#160; See &#8220;Credit 
Agreement&#8221; below for additional information.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#160;</div>
<div style="MARGIN-TOP: 10pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10pt; CLEAR: both" 
id="DSPFPageBreakArea">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center" id="DSPFPageNumberArea"><font style="FONT-STYLE:
normal; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE:
10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: normal" id="DSPFPageNumber">15</font></div>
<div style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always" id="DSPFPageBreak">
<hr style="BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; MARGIN: 4px 0px; 
WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0px; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0px; HEIGHT: 2px; 
COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: both; BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0px" noshade="noshade">
</div>
<div style="WIDTH: 100%" id="DSPFPageHeader"><a style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt" 
href="#TableofContents">Table of Contents</a></div>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Based upon its current cash position, its current reserve 
estimates and its current development plan of the Beta Project, the Fund expects
cash flow from operations and borrowings to be sufficient to cover its 
commitments, as well as ongoing operations. Reserve estimates are projections 
based on engineering data that cannot be measured with precision, require 
substantial judgment, and are subject to frequent revision.&#160; However, if 
cash flow from operations is not sufficient to meet the Fund&#8217;s capital 
commitments, the Manager will take action, which may include adjusting its 
management fee temporarily or acquiring short-term debt to accommodate the 
Fund&#8217;s short-term capital commitments.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Manager is entitled to receive an annual management fee 
from the Fund regardless of the Fund&#8217;s profitability in that year.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Distributions, if any, are funded from available cash from 
operations, as defined in the LLC Agreement, and the frequency and amount are 
within the Manager&#8217;s discretion.&#160; Due to the significant capital 
required to develop the Beta, Diller and Marmalard projects, distributions have 
been impacted, and will be impacted in the future, by amounts reserved to 
provide for their ongoing development costs, debt service costs, and funding 
their estimated asset retirement obligations.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Credit Agreement</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In November 2012, the Fund entered into a credit agreement (the
&#8220;Credit Agreement&#8221;) with Rahr Energy Investments LLC, as 
administrative agent and lender (and any other banks or financial institutions 
that may in the future become a party thereto), that provides for an aggregate 
loan commitment to the Fund of approximately $24.1 million to provide capital 
toward the funding of the Fund&#8217;s share of development costs on the Beta 
Project.&#160; As of June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015, the Fund had borrowed 
$22.8 million under the Credit Agreement. During the first quarter of 2016, the 
Fund adopted the accounting guidance issued in April 2015 related to the 
presentation of debt issuance costs on the balance sheet as a direct reduction 
from the carrying amount of the debt liability, rather than as an asset. As a 
result, the unamortized debt discounts and deferred financing costs of $0.5 
million as of June 30, 2016 and $0.7 million as of December 31, 2015 are 
presented as&#160;a reduction of &#8220;Long-term borrowings&#8221; on the 
balance sheets.&#160;&#160; Principal and interest amounts are contracted to be 
repaid upon the onset of production of the Beta Project, which commenced in the 
third quarter 2016, over a period not to extend beyond December 31, 2020.&#160; 
The Fund expects operating income from the Beta Project will be sufficient to 
cover the principal and interest payments required under the Credit
Agreement.&#160; See Note 3 of &#8220;Notes to Unaudited Condensed Financial 
Statements&#8221; &#8211; &#8220;Credit Agreement &#8211; Beta Project 
Financing&#8221; contained in Item 1. &#8220;Financial Statements&#8221; within 
Part I of this Quarterly Report for more information regarding the Credit 
Agreement.</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff"><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times 
New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Credit Agreement contains 
customary negative covenants including covenants that limit the Fund&#8217;s 
ability to, among other things, grant liens, change the nature of its business, 
or merge into or consolidate with other persons. The events which constitute 
events of default are also customary for credit facilities of this nature and 
include payment defaults, breaches of representations, warrants and covenants, 
insolvency and change of control. Upon the occurrence of a default, in some 
cases following a notice and cure period, the Lenders under the Credit Agreement
may accelerate the maturity of the Loan and require full and immediate repayment
of all borrowings under the Credit Agreement. The Fund believes it is in 
compliance with all covenants under the Credit Agreement as of June 30, 2016 and
December 31, 2015.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Fund had no off-balance sheet arrangements as of June 30, 
2016 and December 31, 2015 and does not anticipate the use of such arrangements 
in the future.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Contractual Obligations</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Fund enters into participation and joint operating 
agreements with operators.&#160; On behalf of the Fund, an operator enters into 
various contractual commitments pertaining to exploration, development and 
production activities.&#160; The Fund does not negotiate such contracts.&#160; 
No contractual obligations exist as of June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015, 
other than those discussed in &#8220;Estimated Capital Expenditures&#8221; and 
&#8220;Liquidity Needs &#8211; Credit Agreement&#8221; above.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Recent Accounting Pronouncements</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">See Note&#160;1 of &#8220;Notes to Unaudited Condensed 
Financial Statements&#8221; - &#8220;Organization and Summary of Significant 
Accounting Policies&#8221; contained in Item 1. &#8220;Financial 
Statements&#8221; within Part I of this Quarterly Report for a discussion of 
recent accounting pronouncements.</div>
<div>&#160;</div>

<td style="WIDTH: 72pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:

name="p1ITEM4."><!--Anchor--></a>ITEM 4.</td>
<td style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; WIDTH: auto; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">CONTROLS 
AND PROCEDURES</td>
</tr>
</table>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In accordance with Rules 13a-15 and 15d-15 of the Securities 
Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#8220;Exchange Act&#8221;), the 
Fund&#8217;s management, including its Chief Executive Officer and Chief 
Financial Officer, evaluated the effectiveness of the Fund&#8217;s disclosure 
controls and procedures (as defined in Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e) under the 
Exchange Act) as of the end of the period covered by this report.&#160; Based on
that evaluation, the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer 
concluded that the Fund&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures were 
effective as of June 30, 2016.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">There has been no change in the Fund&#8217;s internal control 
over financial reporting that occurred during the three months ended June 30, 
2016 that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect,
the Fund&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.</div>

FONT-SIZE: 10pt">XBRL Taxonomy Extension Schema</div>
</td>
<td style="BACKGROUND-COLOR: #cceeff; WIDTH: 25.82%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">

FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Filed herewith</div>
</td>
</tr>

<DESCRIPTION>EXHIBIT 31.1
<TEXT>
<html>
<head>
<title></title>

<body style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" 
bgcolor="#ffffff" text="#000000">
<div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">EXHIBIT 31.1</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">CERTIFICATION</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">I, Robert E. Swanson, certify that:</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">1.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">I have 
reviewed this Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q of Ridgewood Energy O Fund, 
LLC;</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">2.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Based on 
my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material 
fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in 
light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading
with respect to the period covered by this report;</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">3.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Based on 
my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included
in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition,
results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the 
periods presented in this report;</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">4.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The 
registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for 
establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in 
Exchange Act Rules 13a &#8211; 15(e) and 15d &#8211; 15(e)) and internal control
over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a &#8211; 15(f) and
15d &#8211; 15(f)) for the registrant and have:</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(a)</font>&#160;&#160;<font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Designed 
such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and 
procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material 
information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries,
is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the 
period in which this report is being prepared;</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(b)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Designed 
such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control 
over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide 
reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the 
preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with 
generally accepted accounting principles;</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(c)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Evaluated 
the effectiveness of the registrant&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures 
and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the 
disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this 
report based on such evaluation; and</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(d)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Disclosed 
in this report any change in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over 
financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#8217;s most recent 
fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an 
annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to 
materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial 
reporting; and</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">5.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The 
registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on 
our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the
registrant&#8217;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#8217;s 
board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent 
functions):</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(a)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">All 
significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of 
internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to 
adversely affect the registrant&#8217;s ability to record, process, summarize 
and report financial information; and</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(b)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Any fraud,
whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a 
significant role in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial 
reporting.</font></div>
</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div>
<table style="WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: collapse; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New 
Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id="z84688915519441a386c51162c365074d" 
border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0">
<tr>
<td style="WIDTH: 7%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
COLOR: #000000; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Dated:</div>
</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&#160;</td>
<td style="WIDTH: 41%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">August 9, 2016</div>
</td>

<body style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" 
bgcolor="#ffffff" text="#000000">
<div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">EXHIBIT 31.2</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">CERTIFICATION</div>
<div>&#160;</div>
<div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">I, Kathleen P. McSherry, certify that:</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">1.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">I have 
reviewed this Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q of Ridgewood Energy O Fund, 
LLC;</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">2.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Based on 
my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material 
fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in 
light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading
with respect to the period covered by this report;</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">3.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Based on 
my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included
in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition,
results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the 
periods presented in this report;</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">4.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The 
registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for 
establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in 
Exchange Act Rules 13a &#8211; 15(e) and 15d &#8211; 15(e)) and internal control
over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a &#8211; 15(f) and
15d &#8211; 15(f)) for the registrant and have:</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(a)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Designed 
such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and 
procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material 
information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries,
is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the 
period in which this report is being prepared;</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(b)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Designed 
such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control 
over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide 
reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the 
preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with 
generally accepted accounting principles;</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(c)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Evaluated 
the effectiveness of the registrant&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures 
and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the 
disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this 
report based on such evaluation; and</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(d)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Disclosed 
in this report any change in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over 
financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#8217;s most recent 
fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an 
annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to
materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial 
reporting; and</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">5.</font>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;<font
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The 
registrant&#8217;s other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed, based on 
our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the 
registrant&#8217;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#8217;s 
board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent 
functions):</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(a)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">All 
significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of 
internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to 
adversely affect the registrant&#8217;s ability to record, process, summarize 
and report financial information; and</font></div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; MARGIN-LEFT: 21.6pt"><font style="FONT-FAMILY: 
'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(b)&#160;&#160;</font><font 
style="FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Any fraud,
whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a 
significant role in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial 
reporting.</font></div>
<div>&#160;</div>
</div>
<div>&#160;</div>

<div><br>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">CERTIFICATIONS PURSUANT TO</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif;

2002</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In connection with this Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q of the 
Ridgewood Energy O Fund, LLC (the &#8220;Fund&#8221;) for the period ended June 
30, 2016, as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the date 
hereof, (the &#8220;Report&#8221;), each of the undersigned officers of the Fund
hereby certifies, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. (section) 1350, as adopted pursuant to 
(section) 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that to the best of their 
knowledge:</div>

    <us-
gaap:OrganizationConsolidationBasisOfPresentationBusinessDescriptionAndAccountin
gPoliciesTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-01_To_2016-06-30">&lt;div style="text-
align: justify"&gt;&lt;table id="zf12e9e435642401ba06fa53bb5aa0f26" 
class="DSPFListTable" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="width: 100%; font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="width: 
36pt; font: bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif; vertical-align: 
top"&gt;1.&lt;/td&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="text-align: justify; width: auto; font: 
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif; vertical-align: top"&gt;Organization 
and Summary of Significant Accounting 
Policies&lt;/td&gt;&#13;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13
;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;Organization&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; 
font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Ridgewood Energy O Fund, LLC 
(the "Fund"), a Delaware limited liability company, was formed on December 21, 
2004 and operates pursuant to a limited liability company agreement (the "LLC 
Agreement") dated as of February 16, 2005 by and among Ridgewood Energy 
Corporation (the "Manager") and the shareholders of the Fund, which addresses 
matters such as the authority and voting rights of the Manager and shareholders,
capitalization, transferability of membership interests, participation in costs 
and revenues, distribution of assets and dissolution and winding up.&amp;#160; 
The Fund was organized to primarily acquire interests in oil and gas properties 
located in the United States offshore waters of Texas, Louisiana and Alabama in 
the Gulf of Mexico.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Manager has direct and exclusive control 
over the management of the Fund&amp;#8217;s operations.&amp;#160; With respect 
to project investments, the Manager locates potential projects, conducts due 
diligence, and negotiates and completes the transactions.&amp;#160; The Manager 
performs, or arranges for the performance of, the management, advisory and 
administrative services required for Fund operations.&amp;#160; Such services 
include, without limitation, the administration of shareholder accounts, 
shareholder relations and the preparation, review and dissemination of tax and 
other financial information.&amp;#160; In addition, the Manager provides office 
space, equipment and facilities and other services necessary for Fund
operations.&amp;#160; The Manager also engages and manages the contractual 
relations with unaffiliated custodians, depositories, accountants, attorneys, 
broker-dealers, corporate fiduciaries, insurers, banks and others as required. 
See Notes 2, 3 and 4.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Basis of 
Presentation&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;These unaudited interim condensed financial 
statements have been prepared by the Fund&amp;#8217;s management in accordance 
with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America 
(&amp;#8220;GAAP&amp;#8221;) and in the opinion of management, contain all 
adjustments (consisting of only normal recurring adjustments) necessary to 
present fairly the Fund&amp;#8217;s financial position, results of operations 
and cash flows for the periods presented.&amp;#160; Certain information and note
disclosures normally included in annual financial statements prepared in 
accordance with GAAP have been omitted in these unaudited interim condensed 
financial statements.&amp;#160; The results of operations, financial position, 
and cash flows for the periods presented herein are not necessarily indicative 
of future financial results.&amp;#160; These unaudited interim condensed 
financial statements should be read in conjunction with the Fund&amp;#8217;s 
December 31, 2015 financial statements and notes thereto included in the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s Annual Report on Form 10-K filed with the Securities and 
Exchange Commission (&amp;#8220;SEC&amp;#8221;).&amp;#160; The year-end 
condensed balance sheet data was derived from audited financial statements for 
the year ended December 31, 2015, but does not include all disclosures required 
by GAAP.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: left; font: italic 
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Use of 
Estimates&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The preparation of financial statements in 
accordance with GAAP requires management to make estimates and assumptions that 
affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of 
contingent assets and liabilities as of the date of the financial statements and
the reported amounts of revenue and expense during the reporting period. On an 
ongoing basis, the Manager reviews its estimates, including those related to the
fair value of financial instruments, net property balances, determination of 
proved reserves, impairment of long-lived assets and asset retirement 
obligations. Actual results may differ from those 
estimates.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Fair Value 
Measurements&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The fair value measurement guidance provides a
hierarchy that prioritizes and defines the types of inputs used to measure fair 
value. The fair value hierarchy gives the highest priority to Level 1 inputs, 
which consists of unadjusted quoted prices for identical instruments in active 
markets. Level 2 inputs consist of quoted prices for similar 
instruments.&amp;#160; Level 3 inputs are unobservable inputs and include 
situations where there is little, if any, market activity for the instrument; 
hence, these inputs have the lowest 
priority.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Cash and Cash 
Equivalents&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;All highly liquid investments with maturities,
when purchased, of three months or less, are considered cash equivalents. These 
balances, as well as cash on hand, are included in &amp;#8220;Cash and cash 
equivalents&amp;#8221; on the balance sheet. As of June 30, 2016, the Fund had 
no cash equivalents. At times, deposits may be in excess of federally insured 
limits, which are $250 thousand per insured financial institution.&amp;#160; As 
of June 30, 2016, the Fund&amp;#8217;s bank balances were maintained in 
uninsured bank accounts at Wells Fargo Bank, N.A.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div 
style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align:
left; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Salvage 
Fund&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Fund deposits in a separate interest-bearing 
account, or salvage fund, money to provide for the dismantling and removal of 
production platforms and facilities and plugging and abandoning its wells at the
end of their useful lives in accordance with applicable federal and state laws 
and regulations. Interest earned on the account will become part of the salvage 
fund. There are no restrictions on withdrawals from the salvage 
fund.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Debt Discounts and Deferred 
Financing Costs&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Debt discounts and deferred financing 
costs include lender fees and other costs of acquiring debt (see Note 3. 
&amp;#8220;Credit Agreement &amp;#8211; Beta Project Financing&amp;#8221;) such 
as the conveyance of override royalty interests related to the Beta 
Project.&amp;#160; These costs are deferred and amortized over the term of the 
debt period or until the redemption of the debt. During the first quarter of 
2016, the Fund adopted the accounting guidance issued in April 2015 related to 
the presentation of debt issuance costs on the balance sheet as a direct 
reduction from the carrying amount of the debt liability, rather than as an 
asset. As a result, the unamortized debt discounts and deferred financing costs 
of $0.5 million as of June 30, 2016 and $0.7 million as of December 31, 2015 are
presented as&amp;#160;a reduction of &amp;#8220;Long-term borrowings&amp;#8221; 
on the balance sheets. Amortization expense was $0.1 million during each of the 
three months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015.&amp;#160; Amortization expense was 
$0.2 million during each of the six months ended June 30, 2016 and 
2015.&amp;#160; During the period of asset construction, amortization expense, 
as a component of interest, is capitalized and included on the balance sheet 
within &amp;#8220;Oil and gas 
properties&amp;#8221;.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: left; font: italic 
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Investment in Delta 
House&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div 
style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The
 Fund has investments in Delta House Oil and Gas Lateral, LLC and Delta House 
FPS, LLC (collectively &amp;#8220;Delta House&amp;#8221;), legal entities that 
own interests in a deepwater floating production system operated by LLOG 
Exploration Company.&amp;#160; The Fund accounts for its investment in Delta 
House using the cost method of accounting for investments as it does not have 
the ability to exercise significant influence over such investment.&amp;#160; 
Under the cost method, the Fund recognizes an investment in the equity of an 
investee at cost.&amp;#160;&amp;#160; The Fund recognizes&amp;#160;as income 
dividends received that are distributed from net accumulated earnings of the 
investee since the date of acquisition by the Fund.&amp;#160; Dividends received
in excess of earnings subsequent to the date of investment are considered a 
return of investment and are recorded as reductions of cost of the investment. 
The Fund reviews its cost method investment for impairment at each reporting 
period and when an event or change in circumstances has occurred that may have 
significant adverse effect on the fair value of the investment.&amp;#160; As of 
June 30, 2016, there are no such events or changes in circumstances that 
indicate that the Fund&amp;#8217;s investment in Delta House is 
impaired.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Oil and Gas 
Properties&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Fund invests in oil and gas properties, 
which are operated by unaffiliated entities that are responsible for drilling, 
administering and producing activities pursuant to the terms of the applicable 
operating agreements with working interest owners. The Fund&amp;#8217;s portion 
of exploration, drilling, operating and capital equipment expenditures is billed
by 
operators.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;d
iv style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times,
serif"&gt;Exploration, development and acquisition costs are accounted for using
the successful efforts method. Costs of acquiring unproved and proved oil and 
natural gas leasehold acreage, including lease bonuses, brokers&amp;#8217; fees 
and other related costs are capitalized. Costs of drilling and equipping 
productive wells and related production facilities are capitalized.&amp;#160; 
The costs of exploratory wells are capitalized pending determination of whether 
proved reserves have been found.&amp;#160; If proved commercial reserves are not
found, exploratory well costs are expensed as dry-hole costs.&amp;#160; At 
times, the Fund receives adjustments to certain wells from their respective 
operators upon review and audit of the wells&amp;#8217; costs.&amp;#160; 
Interest costs related to the Credit Agreement (see Note 3. &amp;#8220;Credit 
Agreement &amp;#8211; Beta Project Financing&amp;#8221;) are capitalized during 
the period of asset construction. Annual lease rentals and exploration expenses 
are expensed as incurred.&amp;#160; All costs related to production activity, 
transportation expense and workover efforts are expensed as 
incurred.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Once a well has been determined to be fully 
depleted or upon the sale, retirement or abandonment of a property, the cost and
related accumulated depletion and amortization, if any, is eliminated from the 
property accounts, and the resultant gain or loss is 
recognized.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;As of June 30, 2016 and December 31, 2015, 
amounts recorded in due to operators totaling $1.0 million and $0.5 million, 
respectively, related to capital expenditures for oil and gas 
properties.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Advances to 
Operators for Working Interests and Expenditures&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div 
style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The 
Fund may be required to advance its share of the estimated succeeding 
month&amp;#8217;s expenditures to the operator for its oil and gas properties. 
As the costs are incurred, the advances are reclassified to proved 
properties.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Asset Retirement 
Obligations&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;For oil and gas properties, there are 
obligations to perform removal and remediation activities when the properties 
are retired. Upon the determination of a property to be either proved or dry, a 
retirement obligation is incurred. The Fund recognizes the fair value of a 
liability for an asset retirement obligation in the period incurred.&amp;#160; 
Plug and abandonment costs associated with unsuccessful projects are expensed as
dry-hole costs.&amp;#160; As indicated above, the Fund maintains a salvage fund 
to provide for the funding of asset retirement 
obligations.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Syndication 
Costs&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Syndication costs are direct costs incurred by the 
Fund in connection with the offering of the Fund&amp;#8217;s shares, including 
professional fees, selling expenses and administrative costs payable to the 
Manager, an affiliate of the Manager and unaffiliated broker-dealers, which are 
reflected on the Fund&amp;#8217;s balance sheet as a reduction of 
shareholders&amp;#8217; capital.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Revenue Recognition and 
Imbalances&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Oil and gas revenues are recognized when oil 
and gas is sold to a purchaser at a fixed or determinable price, when delivery 
has occurred and title has transferred, and collectability of the revenue is 
reasonably assured.&amp;#160; The Fund uses the sales method of accounting for
gas production imbalances.&amp;#160; The volumes of gas sold may differ from the
volumes to which the Fund is entitled based on its interests in the 
properties.&amp;#160; These differences create imbalances that are recognized as
a liability only when the properties&amp;#8217; estimated remaining reserves net
to the Fund will not be sufficient to enable the underproduced owner to recoup 
its entitled share through production.&amp;#160; The Fund&amp;#8217;s recorded 
liability, if any, would be reflected in other liabilities.&amp;#160; No 
receivables are recorded for those wells where the Fund has taken less than its 
share of production.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Impairment of Long-Lived 
Assets&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times
New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Fund reviews the carrying value of its oil and 
gas properties annually and when management determines that events and 
circumstances indicate that the recorded carrying value of properties may not be
recoverable.&amp;#160; Impairments are determined by comparing estimated future 
net undiscounted cash flows to the carrying value at the time of the 
review.&amp;#160; If the carrying value exceeds the estimated future net 
undiscounted cash flows, the carrying value of the asset is written down to fair
value, which is determined using estimated future net discounted cash flows from
the asset.&amp;#160; The fair value determinations require considerable judgment
and are sensitive to change.&amp;#160; Different pricing assumptions, reserve 
estimates or discount rates could result in a different calculated 
impairment.&amp;#160; Given the volatility of oil and natural gas prices, it is 
reasonably possible that the Fund&amp;#8217;s estimate of discounted future net 
cash flows from proved oil and natural gas reserves could change in the near 
term.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Significant declines in oil and natural gas 
prices since fourth quarter 2014 have impacted the fair value of the 
Fund&amp;#8217;s oil and gas properties. During the six months ended June 30, 
2016, the Fund recorded impairments of oil and gas properties of $13 thousand, 
which represented the carrying value of Eugene Island 346/347.&amp;#160; The 
impairment was primarily attributable to declines in future oil and gas 
prices.&amp;#160; There were no impairments of oil and gas properties during the
three months ended June 30, 2016 and during the three and six months ended June 
30, 2015.&amp;#160; If oil and natural gas prices continue to decline, even if 
only for a short period of time, it is possible that additional impairments of 
oil and gas properties will occur.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Depletion
 and Amortization&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font:
10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Depletion and amortization of the cost of
proved oil and gas properties are calculated using the units-of-production 
method.&amp;#160; Proved developed reserves are used as the base for depleting 
capitalized costs associated with successful exploratory well costs, development
costs and related facilities. The sum of proved developed and proved undeveloped
reserves is used as the base for depleting or amortizing leasehold acquisition 
costs.&amp;#160; During the three and six months ended June 30, 2015, the Fund 
recorded $0.2 million of depletion expense related to adjustments to asset 
retirement obligations for fully depleted 
properties.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Income 
Taxes&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times 
New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;No provision is made for income taxes in the 
financial statements.&amp;#160; The Fund is a limited liability company, and as 
such, the Fund&amp;#8217;s income or loss is passed through and included in the 
tax returns of the Fund&amp;#8217;s shareholders.&amp;#160; The Fund files U.S. 
Federal and State tax returns and the 2013 through 2015 tax returns remain open 
for examination by tax authorities.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-
align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Income and
Expense Allocation&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; 
font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Profits and losses are allocated to
shareholders and the Manager in accordance with the LLC 
Agreement.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: italic
bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;Distributions&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify;
font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Distributions to shareholders are 
allocated in proportion to the number of shares held.&amp;#160; The Manager 
determines whether available cash from operations, as defined in the LLC 
Agreement, will be distributed. Such distributions are allocated 85% to the 
shareholders and 15% to the Manager, as required by the LLC 
Agreement.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Available cash from dispositions, as defined 
in the LLC Agreement, will be paid 99% to shareholders and 1% to the Manager 
until the shareholders have received total distributions equal to their capital 
contributions.&amp;#160; After shareholders have received distributions equal to
their capital contributions, 85% of available cash from dispositions will be 
distributed to shareholders and 15% to the Manager.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div
style="text-align: justify"&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div 
style="text-align: justify; font: italic bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times, 
serif"&gt;Recent Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div 
style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;In 
January 2016, the Financial Accounting Standards Board 
(&amp;#8220;FASB&amp;#8221;) issued accounting guidance that requires, among 
other things, companies to measure investments in other entities, except those 
accounted for under the equity method, at fair value and recognize any changes 
in fair value in net income unless an election is made to record the investment 
at cost, less impairment and plus or minus subsequent adjustments for observable
price changes with change in basis reported in current earnings. This 
pronouncement is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2017 
and interim periods within those fiscal years, with early adoption not 
permitted. The Fund is currently evaluating the impact of this guidance on its 
financial statements.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;In April 2015, the FASB issued accounting 
guidance related to the presentation of debt issuance costs on the balance sheet
as a direct reduction from the carrying amount of the debt liability, consistent
with debt discounts, rather than as an asset.&amp;#160; Amortization of debt 
issuance costs will continue to be reported as interest expense.&amp;#160; In 
August 2015, the FASB issued accounting guidance related to the presentation and
subsequent measurement of debt issuance costs associated with line-of-credit 
arrangements which clarifies that companies may continue to present unamortized 
debt issuance costs associated with line of credit arrangements as an 
asset.&amp;#160; These pronouncements are effective for fiscal years, and 
interim periods within those years, beginning after December 15, 2015, with 
early adoption permitted.&amp;#160; The Fund adopted the accounting guidance in 
first quarter 2016, resulting in a one-time reclassification of $0.7 million of 
unamortized debt discounts and deferred financing costs from "Other assets" to 
"Long-term borrowings" on the balance sheet as of December 31, 2015. Long-term 
borrowings are presented net of $0.5 million of unamortized debt discounts and 
deferred financing costs as of June 30, 2016. The adoption of these 
pronouncements did not impact the Fund&amp;#8217;s results of operations or cash
flows.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;In 2014, the FASB issued accounting guidance 
on revenue recognition, which provides for a single five-step model to be 
applied to all revenue contracts with customers. In 2015, the FASB issued a 
deferral of the effective date of the guidance to 2018, with early adoption 
permitted in 2017. In May 2016, the FASB issued final amendments which provided 
narrow scope improvements and practical expedients related to the implementation
of the guidance. The Fund is currently evaluating the impact of this guidance on
its financial statements.&lt;/div&gt;</us-
gaap:OrganizationConsolidationBasisOfPresentationBusinessDescriptionAndAccountin
gPoliciesTextBlock>
    <us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="D2016-01-

serif"&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;&lt;td style="width: 36pt; font: bold 10pt Times

style="text-align: justify; width: auto; font: bold 10pt Times New Roman, Times,

Parties&lt;/td&gt;&#13;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;
&lt;div&gt;&lt;br /&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: 
justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;Pursuant to the terms of 
the LLC Agreement, the Manager renders management, administrative and advisory 
services to the Fund.&amp;#160; For such services, the Manager is entitled to an
annual management fee, payable monthly, of 2.5% of total capital contributions, 
net of cumulative dry-hole and related well costs incurred by the 
Fund.&amp;#160; Management fees during the three and six months ended June 30, 
2016 were $0.3 million and $0.7 million, respectively. Management fees during 
the three and six months ended June 30, 2015 were $0.4 million and $0.7 million,
respectively.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;The Manager is entitled to receive a 15% 
interest in cash distributions from operations made by the Fund.&amp;#160; The 
Fund did not pay distributions during the three and six months ended June 30, 
2016 and during the three months ended June 30, 2015. Distributions paid to the 
Manager during the six months ended June 30, 2015 were $27 
thousand.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;di
v style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;At 
times, short-term payables and receivables, which do not bear interest, arise 
from transactions with affiliates in the ordinary course of 
business.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div&gt;&lt;br 
/&gt;&#13;&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 10pt 
Times New Roman, Times, serif"&gt;None of the amounts paid to the Manager have 
been derived as a result of arm&amp;#8217;s length 
negotiations.&lt;/div&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;div style="text-align: justify; font: 
10pt Times New Roman, Times,

interest ownership in certain projects to acquire and develop oil and natural 
gas projects with other entities that are likewise managed by the
